Module net.automatalib.util
Package net.automatalib.util.automaton.fsa

Class NFAs

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.automatalib.util.automaton.fsa.NFAs
  • public final class NFAs
extends Object
    Operations on NFAs.

    Note that the methods provided by this class do not modify their input arguments. Furthermore, results are copied into new datastructures. For read-only views you may use the more generic Acceptors factory.

    • Method Detail

      • and

        public static <I> CompactNFA<I> and​(NFA<?,​I> nfa1,
                                    NFA<?,​I> nfa2,
                                    Alphabet<I> inputAlphabet)
        Calculates the conjunction ("and") of two NFAs via product construction and returns the result as a new NFA.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa1 - the first NFA
        nfa2 - the second NFA
        inputAlphabet - the input alphabet
        Returns:
        a new NFA representing the conjunction of the specified NFA

      • and

        public static <I,​S,​A extends MutableNFA<S,​I>> A and​(NFA<?,​I> nfa1,
                                                                      NFA<?,​I> nfa2,
                                                                      Collection<? extends I> inputs,
                                                                      A out)
        Calculates the conjunction ("and") of two NFAs via product construction and stores the result in a given mutable NFA.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        S - state type
        A - automaton type
        Parameters:
        nfa1 - the first NFA
        nfa2 - the second NFA
        inputs - the input symbols to consider
        out - a mutable NFA for storing the result
        Returns:
        out, for convenience

                                   NFA<?,​I> nfa2,
                                   Alphabet<I> inputAlphabet)
        Calculates the disjunction ("or") of two NFAs by merging their states and transitions. Returns the result as a new NFA.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa1 - the first NFA
        nfa2 - the second NFA
        inputAlphabet - the input alphabet
        Returns:
        a new NFA representing the conjunction of the specified NFA

        public static <I> CompactNFA<I> reverse​(NFA<?,​I> nfa,
                                        Alphabet<I> inputAlphabet)

      • reverse

        public static <SI,​I,​SO,​A extends MutableNFA<SO,​I>> Mapping<SO,​SI> reverse​(NFA<SI,​I> nfa,
                                                                                                        Collection<? extends I> inputs,
                                                                                                        A out)
        Writes an NFA for the reverse language of the given input NFA into the given output NFA.
        Type Parameters:
        SI - (input) state type
        I - input symbol type
        SO - (output) state type
        A - (output) automaton type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the input NFA
        inputs - the input symbols to consider
        out - the output NFA
        Returns:
        a mapping from output states to their original input states

      • trim

        public static <I> CompactNFA<I> trim​(NFA<?,​I> nfa,
                                     Alphabet<I> inputAlphabet)
        Creates a trim NFA from the given input NFA. An NFA is trim if all of its states are accessible and co-accessible.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the input NFA
        inputAlphabet - the input alphabet
        Returns:
        the trim NFA
        See Also:
        accessibleStates(NFA, Collection), coaccessibleStates(NFA, Collection)

      • trim

        public static <SI,​I,​SO,​A extends MutableNFA<SO,​I>> A trim​(NFA<SI,​I> nfa,
                                                                                  Collection<? extends I> inputs,
                                                                                  A out)
        Creates a trim NFA from the given input NFA and writes it to the given output NFA. An NFA is trim if all of its states are accessible and co-accessible.
        Type Parameters:
        SI - (input) state type
        I - input symbol type
        SO - (output) state type
        A - (output) automaton type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the input NFA
        inputs - the input symbols to consider
        out - the output NFA
        Returns:
        out for convenience
        See Also:
        accessibleStates(NFA, Collection), coaccessibleStates(NFA, Collection)

      • accessibleStates

        public static <S,​I> Set<S> accessibleStates​(NFA<S,​I> nfa,
                                                  Collection<? extends I> inputs)
        Returns for a given NFA the set of accessible states. A state is accessible if it can be reached by an initial state.
        Type Parameters:
        S - state type
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the input NFA
        inputs - the input symbols to consider
        Returns:
        the set of accessible states

      • coaccessibleStates

        public static <S,​I> Set<S> coaccessibleStates​(NFA<S,​I> nfa,
                                                    Collection<? extends I> inputs)
        Returns for a given NFA the set of co-accessible states. A state is co-accessible if it reaches an accepting state.
        Type Parameters:
        S - state type
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the input NFA
        inputs - the input symbols to consider
        Returns:
        the set of co-accessible states

      • determinize

        public static <I> CompactDFA<I> determinize​(NFA<?,​I> nfa,
                                            Alphabet<I> inputAlphabet)
        Determinizes the given NFA, and returns the result as a new complete DFA.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the original NFA
        inputAlphabet - the input alphabet
        Returns:
        the determinized NFA

      • determinize

        public static <I> CompactDFA<I> determinize​(NFA<?,​I> nfa,
                                            Alphabet<I> inputAlphabet,
                                            boolean partial,
                                            boolean minimize)
        Determinizes the given NFA, and returns the result as a new DFA.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the original NFA
        inputAlphabet - the input alphabet
        partial - allows the new DFA to be partial
        minimize - whether to minimize the DFA
        Returns:
        the determinized NFA

      • determinize

        public static <I> void determinize​(NFA<?,​I> nfa,
                                   Collection<? extends I> inputs,
                                   MutableDFA<?,​I> out,
                                   boolean partial,
                                   boolean minimize)
        Determinizes the given NFA, and stores the result in a given mutable DFA.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        nfa - the original NFA
        inputs - the input symbols to consider
        out - a mutable DFA for storing the result
        partial - allows the new DFA to be partial
        minimize - whether to minimize the DFA
